Lightsleep 4.0.1 API Specification

Lightsleep is a lightweight Object-Relational (O/R) mapping library and is available in Java 8 and later.

See: Description

Packages 
Package Description
org.lightsleep
Classes you use primarily.
org.lightsleep.component
Classes you use to create SQL components such as conditions and expressions.
org.lightsleep.connection
Classes that supply connection wrapper classes to this library using various connection pool libraries.
org.lightsleep.database
Classes for generating SQL for various DBMSs.
org.lightsleep.database.anchor
Classes used in mapping words contained in JDBC URLs to classes in the org.lightsleep.database package.
org.lightsleep.entity
Annotation classes and interfaces you use when creating entity classes.
org.lightsleep.helper
Helper classes used inside this library.
org.lightsleep.logger
Classes that output logs inside this library using various logging libraries.
Lightsleep is a lightweight Object-Relational (O/R) mapping library and is available in Java 8 and later. It does not work in Java 7 and earlier.
It is not compatible with the Java Persistence API (JPA).

It has the following features.
  • It has APIs using features added in Java 8 (functional interface and Optional class).
  • It is easy to understand intuitively because method names resemble reserved words in SQL.
  • It is easy to use for batch programs because there is no library dependent on Java runtime and JDBC driver.
  • No mapping definition file such as XML file is necessary.
  • Learning is relatively easy because it is not a large library.
Japanese
